title: Ohms law - calculate Delta-V from rho L A and I

content.question: A <math alttext="0.20 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> long wire made from a material of resistivity of <math alttext="1.1 times, 10 to the negative 6 power, ohm meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></math> has a cross-sectional area of <math alttext="5.0 times, 10 to the negative 8 power, meter squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. There is a <math alttext="1.5 amps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math> current in the wire. What is the potential difference across the wire?

choices.label: <math alttext="4.1 times, 10 to the negative 13 power, volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>13</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></math>

<math alttext="1.7 times, 10 to the negative 6 power, volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
